column1: Juvenile angiofibroma is a noncancerous growth that causes bleeding in the nose and sinuses.
The tumor contains many blood vessels, spreads within the area in which it started (locally invasive), and can cause bone damage.
A procedure called embolization may be done to prevent the tumor from bleeding.
Complications may include: - Anemia - Pressure on the brain (rare) - Spread of the tumor to the nose, sinuses, and other structures
